org.ensembl.driver
Interface CoordinateSystemAdaptor

All Superinterfaces:
Adaptor, java.rmi.Remote
public interface CoordinateSystemAdaptor
extends Adaptor

Provides access to coordinate system and meta data in the datasource(s). By default meta data is only read from the datasource returned by getDataSource(). Meta tables from additional datasources will also be read if they are added via addDataSource(DataSource).

Field Summary

fetch

public CoordinateSystem fetch(long internalID)
                       throws AdaptorException
Fetch a CoordinateSystem by its internalID.

Returns:
A CoordinateSystem matching the internalID, or null if non found.
Throws:
AdaptorException

fetch

public CoordinateSystem fetch(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String version)
                       throws AdaptorException
Fetch a CoordinateSystem by name and version. If version==null then the returned CoordinateSystem will be the "default" coordinate system with the specified name unless there is another one in the db with the specified name and version set to NULL.

Parameters:
name - name of the coordinate system.
version - version of the coordinate system. Can be null.
Returns:
The coordinate system object represented by name and version, or null.
Throws:
AdaptorException
See Also:
CoordinateSystem.isDefault()

fetchComplete

public CoordinateSystem fetchComplete(CoordinateSystem cs)
                               throws AdaptorException
Returns a complete CoordinateSystem maching _cs_.name and _cs_.version.

Parameters:
cs - partial or complete CoordinateSystem.
Returns:
a complete CoordinateSystem maching _cs_.name and _cs_.version, if available otherwise null.
Throws:
AdaptorException

fetchAll

public CoordinateSystem[] fetchAll()
                            throws AdaptorException
Fetch all the coordinate systems defined for this species.

Returns:
An array of CoordinateSystem objects representing all the coordinate systems defined for this species.
Throws:
AdaptorException

fetchSequenceLevel

public CoordinateSystem fetchSequenceLevel()
                                    throws AdaptorException
Fetch the co-ordinate system that represents the sequence level for this species. If more than one co-ordinate system is defined as being the top level, this will return the one which is defined as being the default. Only one co-ordinate system should be defined as being default and top level.

Returns:
The coordinate system that represents sequence for this species.
Throws:
AdaptorException

getMappingPath

public CoordinateSystem[] getMappingPath(CoordinateSystem cs1,
                                         CoordinateSystem cs2)
                                  throws AdaptorException
Get the mapping path between two co-ordinate systems, as defined in the meta table.

Parameters:
cs1 - The first co-ordinate system.
cs2 - The second co-ordinate system.
Returns:
Array of CoordinateSystems in order from assembled to smaller component co-ordinate systems.
Throws:
AdaptorException

fetchByMap

public CoordinateSystem fetchByMap(java.lang.String map)
                            throws AdaptorException
This function supports old style Locations with Maps. Maps are essentially CoordinateSystems so we retrieve one by mapname

Parameters:
map - a Map identifier
Returns:
the equivalent CoordinateSystem object
Throws:
AdaptorException

fetchAllByFeatureTable

public CoordinateSystem[] fetchAllByFeatureTable(java.lang.String featureTableName)
                                          throws AdaptorException
Retrieve a list of the coordinate systems in which features in a particular table are stored.

Parameters:
featureTableName - The name of the feature table to query.
Returns:
An array of the co-ordinate systems used in this feature table.
Throws:
AdaptorException - if there is a problem communicating with the database, or if featureTableName does not refer to an existing feature table.

fetchTopLevelLocations

public java.util.List fetchTopLevelLocations()
                                      throws AdaptorException
There is one top level location for each sequence region in the highest ranked coordinate system.

Returns:
zero or more top level locations.
Throws:
AdaptorException

addEnsemblDriver

public void addEnsemblDriver(EnsemblDriver driver)
Add an additional driver to retrieve meta information from.

Parameters:
driver - source of additional information.

removeEnsemblDriver

public boolean removeEnsemblDriver(EnsemblDriver driver)
Removes additional datasource.

Parameters:
driver - source to be removed.
Returns:
true of driver was removed, otherwise false.

getEnsemblDrivers

public java.util.List getEnsemblDrivers()
                                 throws AdaptorException
All drivers that coordinate systems will be loaded from. The returned list contains this instance plus those added via addEnsemblDriver().

Returns:
zero or more EnsemblDrivers.
Throws:
AdaptorException
